chineseMeaning: vt. 让位 退位;辞职;
examples: He was forced to abdicate his claim on the property.
He's abdicated all responsibility in the affair.
The king was forced to abdicate his throne.
It's illegal to aid and abet a thief.
He wouldn't throw the stone if those boys did not abet him.
To tolerate evil is to abet it; coddling wrong only helps the devil.
They abhor all forms of racial discrimination.
Most people abhor cruelyt to children.
I abhor every commonplace phrase by which wit is intended.
I will put my dwelling place among you, and I will not abhor you.
Most people abhor cruelty to children.

chineseMeaning: adj. 卑贱的;不幸的;可怜的;
examples: She was not aware that the English habits of comfort attach an idea of abject misery to the idea of a barefootedtraveller.
There's nothing to corroborate your story.
Some observations do seem to corroborate the idea.
Experiments have corroborated her predictions.
His friend corroborated his guilt.
She wished she could smooth away the wrinkles from his corrugated brow.
Sheets of corrugated iron are often used for roofs and fences.
As a child,she has been spoiled and cosseted.
Our kind of travel is definitely not suitable for people who expect to be cosseted.
His grandpa and grandma cosset him, they will give whatever he wants.
He acted with forbearance toward the hecklers.
We've always taken an attitude of forbearance.
I have shown enough forbearance toward him.
He exercises forbearance in dealing with people.
The second principle is forbearance.

chineseMeaning: v. 领先;先发制人,阻止,妨碍;
examples: She forestalled my plan to meet her.
I have my objection all prepared,but Stephens forestall me.
We must act now to forestall disaster.
We installed an alarm system to forestall break-in.
These machine parts have been forged with the finest steel.
George was forced to forge a signature.
They forged their manager's signature on the cheque.
They tried to forge an alliance.

chineseMeaning: adj. 直截的;直率的;坦白的;
examples: She gave him a forthright answer.
His forthright behavior offends some people.
His forthright behaviour shows that he's honest, but he seems rude to some people.
His frank and forthright action deserves praise.
He spoke in a forthright manner but without anger.
American humor is founded largely on hyperbole.
The phrase is of course a hyperbole.
The film is being promoted with all the usual hyperbole.
Don't believe his hypocritical words.
Their hypocritical lies can not cover the ironclad facts.

chineseMeaning: v. 奉为偶像;盲目崇拜;

examples: No one would criticize them ruthless or impious.
What implements are needed for gardening?
That implement is useful for many purposes in the kitchen.
The system can preferably implement automatic text categorization for Chinese pages, and has a higher quality.

chineseMeaning: v. 强求;硬要;胡搅蛮缠; adj. 胡搅蛮缠的;
examples: It is not cost-efficient that sometimes we make ourselves exhausted just to importune something.

chineseMeaning: 显然的 明显易懂的; 显现 显露
examples: His generosity manifests itself in times of difficulties.
No one can manifest the truth of his statement.
The contradiction manifested itself in the employment situation.
He doesn't manifest much interest in his studies.

chineseMeaning: 显而易见的 明显的
examples: The patent runs out in three years time.
He got a patent for this invention.

chineseMeaning: n. 外表 氛围 气场
examples: The cross is finished with an antiqued brown patina.
This tripod has a beautiful patina and an air of great antiquity.
He looked relaxed and elegant and had the patina of success.
The concert was rather a scrappy affair.
The note was written on a scrappy bit of paper.
I have only a scrappy knowledge of the latest scientific achievements.
"It was a scrappy game," he told Sky Sports.
'He is still that scrappy kid from Scranton who beat the odds.
It was a scrappy, rambling speech.
The speaker spoke so fast that he could only scribble down several broken words.
Do not scribble on the wall!
The students are told not to scribble on the desk.
